intro: Ervum terronii, commonly known as the Terronii vetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, ranging in color from white to pale purple. Ervum terronii plays a role in soil stabilization and can be used in ecological restoration projects.
